According to Plana, the corresponding terms in the 
expression of the secular equation are 
[equation not transcribed]
Hence we see that the terms now taken into consideration 
have the effect of making the second term of the 
secular equation more than three times as great as 
it would otherwise be. Of course, the succeeding 
terms will also be essentially changed.
The correction <s>which we have thus found <\s> to be applied to Plana’s value of 
the secular acceleration is therefore 
[functions not transcribed]
where t <s>denotes the number of <\s> is expressed in years 
&[?] the numerical value of this correction is 
[function not transcribed]
This result will serve to give an idea of the 
numerical importance of the new terms & probably 
will not differ widely from the truth, though in order 
to obtain a sufficiently accurate value to be definitively used, the approximation 
must be carried considerably further.
